intro: Cirsium imbricatum, commonly known as the rough hedgehog. It is a perennial flowering plant native to North America, particularly found in prairies and dry open woods. The plant features spiny, glandular leaves and produces purple to pinkish-purple flower heads that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture, and the stems are often covered in bristly hairs. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads and medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
